itemDescription: English middle-distance runner, soldier and school headmaster

wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant-Colonel Henry Stuart Townend  (24 April 1909 – 26 October 2002), known as "The Colonel" during his career as a schoolmaster, was a British Army officer, athlete, headmaster, and Liberal Party politician. Townend was the first headmaster to educate an heir to the British throne, having founded Hill House School in 1949.
